channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dartmouth’s President, Sian Leah Beilock, Called in Police Quickly. The Fallout Was Just as Swift.
item.description: Local law enforcement went in just a couple of hours after a protest encampment went up.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Observes a Solemn Memorial Day
item.description: Increasingly isolated over its war in Gaza, the country is holding a day of mourning as its people struggle to recover from the trauma of the Oct. 7 attacks.

item.title: Smartphone giant Xiaomi is making a new move on Tesla
item.description: An SUV would mark a big expansion of Xiaomi’s $10 billion EV endeavor, spearheaded personally by billionaire co-founder Lei Jun.

item.title: How Biden Adopted Trump’s Trade War With China
item.description: The president has proposed new barriers to electric vehicles, steel and other goods.

item.title: Chinese Woman Jailed for Reporting on Covid Set to be Freed
item.description: Yet Zhang Zhan’s supporters and human rights activists who had followed her case said they could not reach her or her family members.

item.title: Beijing narrowly escapes having to cover the debts of developer Country Garden
item.description: Last week, Country Garden revealed that it had missed an interest payment on onshore bonds guaranteed by a state-owned financial firm.

item.title: The Simple Math That Could Swing the Election to Biden
item.description: He is focused on firming up his Democratic base even though the election will come down to centrist swing voters in battleground states.

item.title: Activists Hold Annual Israeli-Palestinian Memorial Day Ceremony
item.description: “Many people have woken up to the reality that this conflict cannot go on,” said a director of one Israeli peace-building group, referring to the decades of violence.

item.title: Global megarich are paying up to $2 million a week for superyacht rentals but smaller boat charters are down
item.description: IYC CEO Raphael Sauleau said he’s seeing more customers willing to pay a higher premium for the ultimate ocean experience.

item.title: A New Rent-Versus-Buy Calculator
item.description: Does it make sense for you to buy a home right now?

item.title: Israelis Head to Sites of Oct. 7 Attack to Observe National Day of Mourning
item.description: “Our hearts are broken,” one mourner said at the site of a rave for peace and love where hundreds were killed in the Hamas-led attack on Oct. 7.

item.title: Roger Corman: 'King of the Bs' who directed 'Little Shop of Horrors' has died at 98
item.description: Starting in 1955, Corman helped create hundreds of B-movies as a producer and director, among them “Black Scorpion,” “Bucket of Blood” and “Bloody Mama.”

item.title: A Night to Remember at the Opera, Complete With a Phantom
item.description: About 130 children took part in a sleepover at Rome’s opera house, part of a campaign to make up for a lack of music education by making the theater and the art form more familiar and accessible.

item.title: A Night to Remember at the Opera, Complete With a Phantom
item.description: About 130 children took part in a sleepover at Rome’s opera house, part of a campaign to make up for a lack of music education by making the theater and the art form more familiar and accessible.

item.title: Bernie Sanders urges Novo Nordisk to lower its drug prices
item.description: Sanders said that he admires Denmark’s welfare system and said that Novo charges roughly ten times more for Ozempic in the U.S. compared with European countries.
